unnormalised: So, someone asked about the future of online learning in India, eh? Well, let me tell you, it’s gonna be wilder than a Bollywood dance sequence! Imagine this: your kiddo's learning quantum physics via VR while simultaneously eating a plate of *aloo paratha*. Welcome to 2030!

Imagine this: your kiddo's learning quantum physics via V-R while simultaneously eating a plate of *aloo paratha*. Welcome to two thousand and thirty!

unnormalised: Seriously though, EdTech's blowing up faster than my auntie's pressure cooker. From Byju's offering personalized learning to 100s of new platforms teaching everything from coding (python anyone?) to classical dance (kathak – v important!), options are multiplying like rabbits after Diwali. My nephew, Rohan, barely goes to his school (DPS, Delhi) anymore. He says "Uncle, I learn better from these YouTube tutorials. Plus, no uniform!" *Hai Ram!*

unnormalised: But hold on, it's not all perfectly buttered *roti*. We still gotta tackle issues like internet access – not everyone in India gets super-fast 5G, ya know? And then there's the whole "screen time" debate. My mom keeps yelling at Rohan, "Eyes will go bad, beta! Go play *gilli danda*!". Plus, can an online course *really* replace a teacher's scolding? I’m not so sure *that* feature is coming to EdTech anytime soon!

unnormalised: Then there's the price. Some of these EdTech courses cost more than my monthly salary at TCS (okay, maybe I exaggerate a bit). Still, affordability is a real concern. We need more initiatives like the government's DIKSHA platform (digitals infrastructure for knowledge sharing) to offer quality education free or at low cost. Otherwise, we're just leaving a bunch of kids behind.

unnormalised: Ultimately, I think online learning will become even more integrated into the traditional system. Expect to see hybrid models, AI-powered tutors, and personalized learning pathways. Maybe even a "Bollywood-themed maths course"? Hey, anything's possible. Just remember to balance the screens with some good old-fashioned *chai* and family time, okay? Don't let the future run you over like a runaway auto-rickshaw!
